question: Question_05_(d)
statement:
In a room two different lightbulbs $A$ and $B$ are installed. According
to the packaging, lightbulb $A$ fails before time $t$ with probability
$F_A(t)=1-e^{-t}$ ($t$ in months). Lightbulb $B$ has a probability
density function for the failure time given by $p_B(t)=Ce^{-2t}.$

Which light bulb has the longer expected lifetime? (i.e. longer average
time to failure.) Show your reasoning.
hints:
The expected lifetime, or the expected time to failure, is the mean
value of the random variable $t$ (the time to failure).
Recall from (a) and (b) that $p_A(t) = e^{-t}$ and $p_B(t) = 2e^{-2t}.$
